Reviews.Title: “Had a delightful Stay at Rosemont,50 John st”
Reviews.Author: neha s
Reviews.Content: I read a lot many reviews before coming to this place and would like to thank all the reviewers It was indeed a splendid stay. I was travelling alone and had to stay in toronto for some 2.5 months due to office work. My stay there was hassle free. My room was cleaned once a week on a particular day. What I specially liked was the kitchen lounge. As I preferred cooking myself, I found the kitchen unit very helpful. Just one glitch that I felt was currency conversion as my money was in US dollars and the admin wanted it only in Canadian Draft or cheque. I would still say, its a nice place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Don't think i'll go back”
Reviews.Author: LivingThai
Reviews.Content: I stayed here June 10 with some family because we wanted to see the falls, I don't think it was really worth the money and the cleaning service wasn't exactly up to par, i too found socks in the drawer and dust on nearly everything. The hotel is convenient though but i'm sure there are better hotels in toronto where you can get better value for money. I stayed there from a recommendation from this website http://www.hotelintoronto.org/glen-grove-suites-hotel.html

Reviews.Title: “Socks under bed”
Reviews.Author: captainbezz
Reviews.Content: Some family and I stayed at Glen Grove and when we got here it seemed like a decency looking place, the staff were nice (but could have been friendlier), and the laundry room was convenient and inexpensive. It, however, wasn't really worth it. There are several unknown stains in the hallway and in the room; when at first got here and unpacked the cooler the kitchen floor was grossly sticky and had food all over it. While looking for a missing bag, my mother found socks underneath the bed, and clean or not that's disgusting. The mini window air conditioner decided to NOT work, instead just blew out warm air. In the middle of June, after walking around all day we would have liked to return to a nice, cool room, instead it was just as hot as it was outside. It also just randomly shut off making it completely miserable.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Nomad1966A
Reviews.Content: Some guest's dog puked on carpet in corridor. Not cleaned for more than 10 days. More messes from dogs appeared, also not cleaned. Inside rooms, even after cleaning team left, filthy. Added to that very unpleasant, unfriendly and unhelpful Ahmad who makes John Cleese's Faulty Towers Basil look like your friendly uncle. Taps dripping all the time and rooms are just smelly and old. Dogs in the rooms bark all day long. For the same price, try Turtle Inn downtown or pay a bit more and go to alternative accommodation. If you like Glengrove as a group, then check in to other suites.

Reviews.Title: “Trust me... stay at the Marriott instead. One of the worst I've seen.”
Reviews.Author: brunseye
Reviews.Content: The carpets are nasty, my room has an annoying water gurgle 24/7 in the bathroom, I can hear the old elevator creaking all night, the blinds are broken, the stereo still has a tape deck, and the old beds are uncomfortable, one door doesn't close... it's one of the most dilapidated places I've ever stayed in in Toronto... and I stay here all the time for business. (the only redeeming feature... a spacious walk-in closet). Trust me... the Marriott, which is literally down the street, is cleaner, cheaper, has free breakfasts and dinners 3 days a week, has much more comfortable beds and amenities, has just as big a kitchen, modern appliances, and has maid service EVERY day instead of only once a week. There is simply no comparison... I'm only here because the Marriott was sold out, and I'd switch hotels but the Glen Grove cunningly doesn't offer refunds once you book. FYI I am not a princess... I've traveled to 30 countries including all over Africa and Afghaninstan, often as a backpacker. This would be *great* if it were a hostel and not a $200/night "upscale" hotel suites.

Reviews.Title: “CLOSE TO EVERYTHING I NEEDED”
Reviews.Author: scrubbietoronto
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for a kidney transplant at Toronto General Hospital. The location was perfect for my family it took them two minutes to walk to the hospital and had all the amenities they required close at hand (grocery stores shopping transportation etc.) The condo was clean comfortable and for it's location reasonably priced. I would not hesitate to book again or recommend this location to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “ROSEMONT, 50 John Street, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dynamicmac
Reviews.Content: Second time at the Rosemont and it was once again a first class place to relax during a hectic visit to Toronto. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which was very spacious , well equipped, and very clean,with fantastic views down to the CN tower and Rogers Centre. The building is a residential block but has many added features accessible at no extra charge including an internet room with free access which is great if you need to check on tours , local restaurants or confirming flights home . It is ideally situated with so many nice bars/restaurants within walking distance, and yet not too far from the main shopping centre . Hey Lucy just round the corner was the best food we ate the whole trip so well worth a visit. I would not hesitate to recommend the ROSEMONT and intend to stay there next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: kiltygirl
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a different apartment with Glengrove and they moved us to The Rosemont because of a booking problem. When we contacted them to say the sleeping arrangements didn't suit (a double bed instead of twin beds) they arranged to put a foldaway bed in the suite for us. We spent 5 nights in The Rosemont and found it to be in a perfect location for sightseeing and convenient for restaurants, shopping etc. We did not have a car and found we did not need one. The apartment was very comfortable, well equipped and clean. There was also a lovely roof terrace with seating, jacuzzi and gas barbecues which was an ideal place to chill out after a day sightseeing. The small charge for the internet was money well spent when travelling with 2 computer addicts! It wasn't very fast but satisfied their needs. Check out time was 11am and we had a few hours before we were being picked up to go to the airport. The concierge very kindly offered to look after our luggage which allowed us to go out for a while. There really wasn't anything we disliked and were pleased Glengrove had moved us there.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location 50 john street”
Reviews.Author: ruth
Reviews.Content: First I would like to point out that the reviews under this site appear to be about two different apartment blocks the Glen grove suites and The Rosemont at 50 John Street. This review is about 50 John street and this is our 3rd visit mainly due to the Location a 2 minute walk from the CN tower and 5 minute walk via PATH to the subway. We stay here because for the same price of one hotel room we get a 2 bed 2 bathroom apartment complete with ful kitchen lounge and washer /dryer, great when travelling with teenagers. This is NOT a Hotel it is a residential buildling where loads of young 20/30 somethings live complete with matching designer dogs .At no time was this a problem we enjoyed looking at the cute little dogs each evening. The apartment is in the entertainment business so there is a bit of noise at the weekends and early morning when the bottle bins are empitied but not a problem. Down the road there a plenty of good restaurants our favourite being Milestones and Hey Lucy. This year we went on The Shark speed boat at the Harbor and had such a good laugh even if we did get wet. Please remember that as this is not a Hotel there is no reception ,no daily maid service just an apartment of your own.There is a telephone with free local calls so with an $5 international phone card we could keep in touch with our daughter who had stayed at home.There is also internet available in the apartment. It is not spotlessly clean but would we come again? yes without a doubt

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Rosemont”
Reviews.Author: OZTOURIST_9
Reviews.Content: January 29, 2009 We (family of four) stayed for 10 days at The Rosemont (Glen Grove Suites) at 50 John Street, Downtown Toronto in January this year. The property is very conveniently located in Downtown Toronto, just one block from the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre, with easy underground access to St Andrew subway station and a short walk to all other downtown attractions, including the Harbour Front. The suite was very clean, well furnished and well maintained. The ensuite washer and dryer, and full kitchen were also a plus. There is underground parking right on the property, which is very convenient. It was real â€œvalue-for-moneyâ€� in an excellent location. The staff (I must make special mention here of the Concierge and also the room service maid, who doubled in to help reset the broadband modem in my suite) were very friendly and helpful. The broadband Internet in the suite (at an additional cost of $25+tax) was a bonus. In addition, there is also a business centre (conveniently located on the second floor) with two computers where you can access the Internet, print off documents, fax and photocopy for free. Checking in is just a matter of picking up your room key at the front desk and checking out is returning your key to the front desk and signing yourself out in a register (quick and painless). There is a 24-hour security guard on duty at the front desk. The master bedroom has a queen bed with two beside cabinets and a chest-of-drawers (with mirror). The second bedroom has a double bed with a bedside cabinet. There is a walk-in-robe to the master bedroom and lots of closets throughout the suite. The bathrooms are bright and modern, one with a tub and the other with shower. The only problem with our suite was that it was facing the back of the building and every alternate day, we heard a garbage truck flipping dumpsters at 7 a.m. But who cared about this, we were on a holiday and those guys did their jobs and were gone in 30 minutes. All in all, a great stay. I would recommend The Rosemont, 50 John Street, Downtown Toronto, ON, Canada to all types of travellers, in particular, families and corporate groups.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: chefboyrz
Reviews.Content: The Glen Grove staff are very courteous and attentive to quest privacy. One of the cleanest establishments I have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Keep driving-Not for families or good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: NNNdealer
Reviews.Content: I have visited Toronto on many occasions and stayed in many locations and am a frequent traveller for business and family fun. On this occassion we stayed here at the Yonge location because it was close to a family member and seemed great for a family stay with 2 kids based on the website photos. What a mistake I made. The place looked like a quaint boutique hotel online and at checkin but only after we unloaded everything and settled into our room late at night did we understand that beauty is only skin deep. It became very apparent that the majority of people staying were either uniformed travellers like us or people who needed the accomodation for their hour escapade with their companion. Lots of noise was coming from several rooms very late at night where others who did not come for a good nights sleep where just starting to have fun. To make matters worse the room was bone shivering cold. I have stayed in Toronto and know that it is not supposed to be this cold. When I called the front desk they said that I must have a window open...how funny. Then they said that the building is on a central unit and no one else was complaining. I asked to be switched to another room and I was refused. We asked the receptionist to have someone come to the room to confirm the heat does not work but they refused. We slept with 2 socks, 2 shirts, pants, and 2 blankets. We were told the next day that we should bring our concern to management that would return on Monday. After speaking to the manager today he offered a meager 10% discount and also pointed out that no one else complained and that it was not the Marriott because we only had to pay $150 for the stay. I am sure the reason no one else complained is because the majority who did stay were their for a party not for sleep. I would confirm that he is correct on one thing that you get what you pay for when you stay here. We did not stay for the price or party we stayed for location. My suggestion is to keep driving. I returned home with my family with all of us having a cold. The $150 will be much more after our visits to the doctors office. I have a degree in hotel restaurant management and have managed restaurants and hotels for a great number of years and know that this is not what is supposed to happen even in budget hotels. I am not a complainer and definitely never participate in these type of forums but I felt angry enough after this visit at the lack of hospitality, basic accomodation, and poor response from management to give other travelers fair warning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean basic accomodation in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: AnroGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay at Glen Grove. It is convenient for travel to downtown Toronto being only a five minute walk to the subway station. Good clean room if a little basic. Air conditioning units were a bit noisy however very welcome in the humidity.

HotelInfo.Name: Glen Grove Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 50 John Street, Toronto, Ontario M5V 3T5, Canada (Formerly Skyline Suites)
